meanings.definition: A line or mark made by folding or wrinkling.
meanings.sent1: The creasing on the paper showed where it had been folded.
meanings.sent2: I noticed a creasing on the fabric where it had been crumpled.
meanings.sent3: The creasing on the map made it look like a treasure hunt.
meanings.sent4: Her face lit up with a smile, creasing her cheeks.
meanings.sent5: The creasing on the old photograph added character to the image.

meanings.definition: To make a line or mark by folding or wrinkling.
meanings.sent1: She was creasing the paper to create a neat edge.
meanings.sent2: The tailor was creasing the fabric before sewing it.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally creased the document while rushing to sign it.
meanings.sent4: The wind creased the surface of the lake, creating ripples.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully creased the dough to seal the filling inside.
